publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-91 Mr Kenny MacAskill: One Hundreth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors- That the Parliament notes that 1999 marks the hundredth anniversary of the founding of the Albion Motor Car Company Ltd and thus one hundred years of Scottish transport history and congratulates the drivers of Albion vehicles for making a centenary road run from London to Glasgow and Biggar Museum Trust for organising a centenary rally to celebrate Scotland's most successful manufacturer of commercial vehicles.
S1M-91 One Hundreth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors (lodged on 11 August) Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-91One Hundreth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors (lodged on 11 August) Michael Russell*

S1M-91 Mr Kenny MacAskill: One Hundreth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors—That the Parliament notes that 1999 marks the hundredth anniversary of the founding of the Albion Motor Car Company Ltd and thus one hundred years of Scottish transport history and congratulates the drivers of Albion vehicles for making a centenary road run from London to Glasgow and Biggar Museum Trust for organising a centenary rally to celebrate Scotland’s most successful manufacturer of commercial vehicles. (lodged on 11 August) Supported by: Alasdair Morgan, Michael Russell
S1M-91 One Hundredth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors (lodged on 11 August) Tricia Marwick*

S1M-91 Mr Kenny MacAskill: One Hundredth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors—That the Parliament notes that 1999 marks the hundredth anniversary of the founding of the Albion Motor Car Company Ltd and thus one hundred years of Scottish transport history and congratulates the drivers of Albion vehicles for making a centenary road run from London to Glasgow and Biggar Museum Trust for organising a centenary rally to celebrate Scotland’s most successful manufacturer of commercial vehicles. Supported by: Alasdair Morgan, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick

S1M-91 Mr Kenny MacAskill: One Hundredth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors—That the Parliament notes that 1999 marks the hundredth anniversary of the founding of the Albion Motor Car Company Ltd and thus one hundred years of Scottish transport history and congratulates the drivers of Albion vehicles for making a centenary road run from London to Glasgow and Biggar Museum Trust for organising a centenary rally to celebrate Scotland’s most successful manufacturer of commercial vehicles. Supported by: Alasdair Morgan, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick

S1M-91 Mr Kenny MacAskill: One Hundredth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors—That the Parliament notes that 1999 marks the hundredth anniversary of the founding of the Albion Motor Car Company Ltd and thus one hundred years of Scottish transport history and congratulates the drivers of Albion vehicles for making a centenary road run from London to Glasgow and Biggar Museum Trust for organising a centenary rally to celebrate Scotland’s most successful manufacturer of commercial vehicles. Supported by: Alasdair Morgan, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick
S1M-91 One Hundredth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors (lodged on 11 August 1999) Linda Fabiani*

S1M-91 Mr Kenny MacAskill: One Hundredth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors—That the Parliament notes that 1999 marks the hundredth anniversary of the founding of the Albion Motor Car Company Ltd and thus one hundred years of Scottish transport history and congratulates the drivers of Albion vehicles for making a centenary road run from London to Glasgow and Biggar Museum Trust for organising a centenary rally to celebrate Scotland’s most successful manufacturer of commercial vehicles. Supported by: Alasdair Morgan, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick, Linda Fabiani

S1M-91 Mr Kenny MacAskill: One Hundredth Anniversary of the Founding of Albion Motors-That the Parliament notes that 1999 marks the hundredth anniversary of the founding of the Albion Motor Car Company Ltd and thus one hundred years of Scottish transport history and congratulates the drivers of Albion vehicles for making a centenary road run from London to Glasgow and Biggar Museum Trust for organising a centenary rally to celebrate Scotland's most successful manufacturer of commercial vehicles. Supported by: Alasdair Morgan, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick, Linda Fabiani
